currentFocus: Patchwork parser implementation - completed Milestone 4 (Basic Expressions), ready for Milestone 5 (Prompt Expressions)
recentAchievements: Implemented full expression parsing: literals, binary/unary ops, calls, member access, indexing
Built manual precedence climbing grammar (10 tiers) avoiding lalrpop conflicts
Added 14 comprehensive tests covering all expression types including precedence validation
All 38 tests passing (24 from M1-3 + 14 new M4 tests), zero conflicts
nextSteps: Milestone 5: Prompt Expressions (think/ask/do blocks - patchwork's unique features)
Implement PromptBlock and PromptItem AST types
Add grammar for prompt expressions with embedded code blocks
collaborativeState: Excellent momentum - tackled and solved lalrpop precedence challenges together, clean solution emerged
keyInsights: Manual precedence climbing > lalrpop #[precedence] for complex grammars - explicit hierarchy prevents conflicts
Each precedence tier as separate rule: AssignExpr → PipeExpr → OrExpr → ... → PostfixExpr → PrimaryExpr
Keywords like 'self' need explicit grammar rules even when they seem like identifiers
Test-driven development caught the 'self' issue immediately
criticalAwareness: Precedence: Assignment (lowest) → Pipe → OR → AND → Comparison → Range → Add/Sub → Mul/Div → Unary → Postfix (highest)
Zero-copy lifetime 'input pattern must be maintained throughout
StringLiteral is currently simple (no interpolation) - Milestone 6 will add ${} support
